action.action-desc: Mr. Sam Johnson of Texas (for himself and Mr. Hinojosa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act with respect to the treatment of hospitals under the Medicare program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Promoting Access, Competition, and Equity Act of 2015 or as the PACE Act of 2015.

section.header: Confirming methodology for hospital star rating system through Hospital Compare
section.text: Section 1886(b)(3)(B)(viii) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395ww(b)(3)(B)(viii)) is amended by adding at the end the following new subclause:

subclause.text: In order to ensure consistent longitudinal comparisons among calendar quarters that began before October 1, 2019, the Secretary shall use the same methodology as is in effect as of April 16, 2015, for computation of the star rating for hospitals posted on the Internet website maintained by the Secretary under subclause (VII) for such calendar quarters. The Secretary may promulgate a regulation to change such methodology used with respect to the computation of such star rating for hospitals for calendar quarters beginning on or after October 1, 2019.

section.header: Revised criteria for application and exceptions to moratorium on expansion and construction of physician-owned hospitals

subsection.text: Section 1877(i)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395nn(i)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(i), by striking or is a high Medicaid facility described in subparagraph (F) and inserting , is a high Medicaid facility described in subparagraph (F), or is a hospital with a consistently high quality rating (as defined in subparagraph (H));
in subparagraph (E), by adding at the end, after the matter added by subsection (a)(1), the following:

quoted-block.quoted-block-continuation-text: Such term includes, with respect to subparagraphs (B) through (D), a hospital with a consistently high quality rating.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end, as amended by subsection (d), the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Hospital with a consistently high quality rating defined
subparagraph.text: In this paragraph, the term hospital with a consistently high quality rating, with respect to a calendar quarter (beginning on or after October 1, 2019), means a hospital that has had a rating of 3 stars or higher under the hospital star rating system posted on the Internet website maintained by the Secretary under section 1886(b)(3)(B)(viii)(VII) for each of the 12 calendar quarters before the calendar quarter involved.

subparagraph.text: In applying this paragraph to a hospital under development as of March 23, 2010 (as defined in paragraph (7)(A)), any reference in this paragraph to the date of enactment of this subsection or to December 31, 2010, shall be deemed to be a reference to May 1, 2015.

paragraph.header: Definitions relating to certain hospitals under development

subparagraph.header: Hospital under development as of March 23, 2010
subparagraph.text: The term hospital under development as of March 23, 2010 means a hospital that—

clause.text: has a binding written agreement with an outside, unrelated party for the actual construction, renovation, lease, or demolition for a hospital under section 1886(d), and has expended, before March 23, 2010, at least 10 percent of the estimated cost of the project (or, if less, $2,500,000); or
has obtained an approved certificate of need in a State where one is required on or before March 23, 2010.

subparagraph.continuation-text: Such term includes, with respect to such a hospital, any facility expansion of the hospital that is completed before the under development effective date.

subparagraph.text: The term under development effective date means the date that is 6 months after the date of the enactment of this paragraph.

subsection.header: Change in processing of applications and elimination of appeals limitation
subsection.text: Section 1877(i)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1305nn(i)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking clauses (ii) through (iv) and inserting the following:

clause.header: Deemed receipt of complete application and approval of application
clause.text: Unless the Secretary otherwise determines, an application submitted under this subparagraph shall be deemed complete as of the date that is 30 days after the date the Secretary receives the complete application. Not later than 60 days after the receipt of such a complete application, the Secretary shall publish a notice of the receipt of the application and a description of the expansion planned in the application. A complete application shall be deemed approved by the Secretary as of the end of the 60-day period beginning on the date of the Secretary’s receipt of the application unless the Secretary provides the applicant with a notice of disapproval of the application before the end of such period.

subsection.text: Except as otherwise provided, the amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and shall apply to applications made after the date of the enactment of this Act.
